summary: Hi there, here\'s my very own ENBseries Setting, look at those beautiful Screenshots ;)
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://img6.imagebanana.com/img/7wzab6ok/cover.png[/img]

Finally i\'ve made my own ENBseries setting! I\'m using HD6\'s and Doublehelix\'s (BIG THX for your work guys!) Version as Base and edited all of the settings to make Skyrim more Cinematic and Colorful - I like high Saturation, High Contrast, and so on... :)

Features of this Setting:
- Bright, saturated colors
- Dark Nights, shiny Stars and really beauftiful Northern Lights
- SSAO is enabled in slow mode
- DOF ([b]Not Bokeh[/b]) is activated and set to 0.1 Fade-Time (very fast)
- High Contrast, so maybe you\'ll need a torch at night

To Install:
It\'s easy... Download and extract to your Skyrim directory (root), done! :)

To Uninstall:
Just delete those downloaded files!

blablabla... do i need to write more? This is a graphical Enhancement, so look at the Screenshots :D

Any Problem?
Feel free to ask! :)


[size=6]CHANGELOG[/size]
[size=5][b]1.5[/b][/size]
New Version added: noBars
As an user request, i\'ve disabled the black bars on top/bottom in this Version

[size=5][b]1.4[/b][/size]
If you can\'t see underwater, here\'s whats going wrong: The d3d9.dll Wrapper of ENBseries in Combination with Skyrims latest Update (1.5) is causing this, it\'s no Bug in this ENBseries Setup! Using a newer d3d9.dll (Maybe 0.108) will fix it, BUT in this versions DOF and SSAO is turned off... So i searched along the World Wide Web to solve that Problem without using another d3d9.dll. After reading a lot of Stuff and doing a lot of Tests i found out how to get that Underwater Thing partially fixed, so here\'s what you have to do:

1. In Windows 7 go to [i]Documents > My Games > Skyrim[/i] and open up [b]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/b]
2. Search for that line [size=3][b]bDoDepthOfField=1[/b][/size] and change it to [size=3][b]bDoDepthOfField=0[/b][/size]
3. Save the File, and you\'re done! :-)

Ingame, you\'ll notice that you can see underwater. The only thing left is, there\'s no more \"Fog\" underwater, it\'s crystal clear, but i think \"Crystal Clear\" is better than \"WTF?! Where am i?\" ;-) Also, this is just a Workaround till ENBseries, or Skyrim is updated!

I\'ve also added a new File \"less Saturation\" - i don\'t need to explain it, right? :D

[size=5][b]1.2[/b][/size]
Two new Versions added, light and without DOF. I\'ve tested the light Setup against the Full Setup and this is what i get (on my System):

Location: Guardian Stones
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB: ~10 FPS
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB light: ~4 FPS

Location: Whiterun (Including Whiterun Tree Mod (Lot of shadows))
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB: ~8 FPS
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB light: ~3 FPS

Location: Saarthal (outside - The FPS in this area is much higher than in other places)
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB: ~20 FPS
FPS Drop Vanilla > ENB light: ~13 FPS

[size=5][b]1.0[/b][/size]
Initial Release
author: infernalshade
